docs.lead_paragraph: Concern about technology — the printing press, the steam engine or the computer — supplanting humans is not new. But this time may be different.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; technological breakthroughs are enabling machines to do knowledge jobs and service jobs, in addition to factory and clerical work; digital technology has over 15-year period inserted itself into nearly every aspect of life even as job market has fallen into long malaise; many economists are not sure about whether technology will create as many jobs as it destroyed, which was the case with previous technological leaps (Series: Nonemployed).
docs.snippet: Concern about technology — the printing press, the steam engine or the computer — supplanting humans is not new. But this time may be different....

headline.print_headline: Smarter Robots Move Deeper Into Workplace

docs.lead_paragraph: DETROIT -- Looking over the cars at the Ford display is passive learning, but driving the AdvanceTrac simulator is active.
docs.abstract: Ford's display has a driving simulator -- a driver's seat on an articulated arm -- that gives showgoers a realistic experience.

docs.lead_paragraph: Computers are fast when it comes to grading test essays, but they can be fooled.
docs.abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column describes University of Akron study that found computerized grading systems are capable of scoring essays on standardized tests as well as human beings do; warns that programs can still be fooled.
docs.snippet: Computers are fast when it comes to grading test essays, but they can be fooled....

headline.seo: Robo-Readers Used to Grade Test Essays
headline.main: Facing a Robo-Grader? Just Keep Obfuscating Mellifluously

docs.lead_paragraph: When Microsoft joined the One Laptop Per Child project earlier this month, I wrote an article noting the change in heart by both sides. The O.L.P.C. project, intended to bring cheap computers to children in poorer nations, had been committed to using the freely distributed Linux operating system, an open-source alternative to Microsoft's Windows. And Microsoft had resisted joining anything that promoted open-source software.
docs.abstract: Walter Bender left One Laptop Per Child in April and speaks out on Microsoft joining the effort. "Microsoft stepping in is the symptom, not the disease," he said in the interview. The issue, in his view, is whether the tools that bring computing to children are "agnostic on learning" or "take a position on learning." Mr. Bender said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Data science offers a lot of promise in many fields, but for now, it seems wise to keep human beings in the loop.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; branch of academic study known as algorithmic accountability is increasingly relevant as data science used in advertising and marketing spreads to other disciplines, where question of whether human supervision is necessary has been raised.
docs.snippet: Data science offers a lot of promise in many fields, but for now, it seems wise to keep human beings in the loop....
